title: Possible ambiguity in padding documentation for some methods
body_html:
In torch.nn.Conv*, the padding parameter is documented as Zero-padding added to both sides of the input but in torch.nn.functional.Conv* this sentence changes to implicit zero padding on the input. Can be a single number or a tuple [0].

At first I thought that this was a difference between the nature of the modules but torch.nn.functional.avg_pool1d also mentions about both sides while torch.nn.avg_pool2d/3d revert back to [0]. So is there really a difference about how the padding is applied between torch.nn and torch.nn.functional or is it the documentation which is not synchronized between modules/methods?

body:
In `torch.nn.Conv*`, the `padding` parameter is documented as **Zero-padding added to both sides of the input** but in `torch.nn.functional.Conv*` this sentence changes to **implicit zero padding on the input. Can be a single number or a tuple** [0].

At first I thought that this was a difference between the nature of the modules but `torch.nn.functional.avg_pool1d` also mentions about **both sides** while `torch.nn.avg_pool2d/3d` revert back to [0]. So is there really a difference about how the padding is applied between `torch.nn` and `torch.nn.functional` or is it the documentation which is not synchronized between modules/methods?
